page.title: 01Our Area
page.content: The landscape of our area is a mixture of residential land,marsh and farmland.Just over a twelfth or one square kilometre is residential,the rest is open country.Our area of sea is a part of the North Sea.The farmland is mainly arable,that means it is used for crops such as peas and cereals.There is some grazing land as well as arable land.Sheep graze on the marsh land.Cows graze on the land near Holland Brook.Holland Brook used to be a larger estuary called Gunfleet.When it has rained heavily or snow has melted,the marshes usually become flooded.Quite a lot of people who live in our area are retired.Many of these people live in bungalows because they do not enjoy going up and down stairs.
